citation.article-title: Taxonomic descriptions of eight new non-sterol-requiring mollicutes assigned to the genus Mesoplasma.

p.s: Description of Mesoplasma chauliocola sp. nov.

Mesoplasma chauliocola (chau.li.o'co.la. M. L. n. chaulio, first part of the genus name of the goldenrod beetle; L. n. incola, inhabitant; M. L. masc. n. chauliocola, inhabitant of the goldenrod beetle)
Cells are primarily coccoid, ranging in diameter from 300 to 500 nm.
Colonies on solid medium containing 0.8% Noble agar usually have the appearance of fried eggs.
Does not hydrolyze arginine or urea.
Agar colonies hemadsorb guinea pig erythrocytes.
Cholesterol or serum is not required for growth, but growth in serum-free media depends on the presence of 0.04% Tween 80 (polyoxyethylene sorbitan).
The temperature range for growth is 10 to 37°C; optimum growth occurs at 32 to 37°C.
Serologically distinct from other Mesoplasma species.
Isolated from the gut fluid of an adult goldenrod soldier beetle (Chauliognathus pennsylvanicus) (Coleoptera: Cantharidae) in Maryland.
Pathogenicity for plants and insects has not been determined.
The average genome size is 930 kbp.
The guanine-plus-cytosine content of the DNA is 28.3 mol%, as determined by Bd, Tm and HPLC methods.
The type strain is CHPA-2 (= ATCC 49578).
